thresholds.explanation:
Roll vs. Will to do anything besides talk or rest; failure causes unconsciousness
Each FP you lose below 0 also causes 1 HP of injury
Move, Dodge and ST are halved (B426)
Move, Dodge and ST are halved (B426)

Roll vs. HT to avoid death
Roll vs. HT-4 every second to avoid falling unconscious
Move and Dodge are halved (B419)

Roll vs. HT to avoid death
Roll vs. HT-3 every second to avoid falling unconscious
Move and Dodge are halved (B419)

Roll vs. HT to avoid death
Roll vs. HT-2 every second to avoid falling unconscious
Move and Dodge are halved (B419)

Roll vs. HT to avoid death
Roll vs. HT-1 every second to avoid falling unconscious
Move and Dodge are halved (B419)

Roll vs. HT every second to avoid falling unconscious
Move and Dodge are halved (B419)

locations.description:
An attack that misses by 1 hits the torso instead. Only
impaling (imp), piercing (pi-, pi, pi+, pi++), and
tight-beam burning (burn) attacks can target the eye – and
only from the front or sides. Injury over HP÷10 blinds the
eye. Otherwise, treat as skull, but without the extra DR!

An attack that misses by 1 hits the torso instead. Wounding
modifier is x4. Knockdown rolls are at -10. Critical hits
use the Critical Head Blow Table (B556). Exception: These
special effects do not apply to toxic (tox) damage.

An attack that misses by 1 hits the torso instead. Jaw,
cheeks, nose, ears, etc. If the target has an open-faced
helmet, ignore its DR. Knockdown rolls are at -5. Critical
hits use the Critical Head Blow Table (B556). Corrosion
(cor) damage gets a x1½ wounding modifier, and if it
inflicts a major wound, it also blinds one eye (both eyes on
damage over full HP). Random attacks from behind hit the
skull instead.

Reduce the wounding multiplier of large piercing (pi+), huge
piercing (pi++), and impaling (imp) damage to x1. Any major
wound (loss of over ½ HP from one blow) cripples the limb.
Damage beyond that threshold is lost.

Reduce the wounding multiplier of large piercing (pi+), huge
piercing (pi++), and impaling (imp) damage to x1. Any major
wound (loss of over ½ HP from one blow) cripples the limb.
Damage beyond that threshold is lost. If holding a shield,
double the penalty to hit: -4 for shield arm instead of -2.

An attack that misses by 1 hits the torso instead. Human
males and the males of similar species suffer double shock
from crushing (cr) damage, and get -5 to knockdown rolls.
Otherwise, treat as a torso hit.

Reduce the wounding multiplier of large piercing (pi+), huge
piercing (pi++), and impaling (imp) damage to x1. Any major
wound (loss of over ½ HP from one blow) cripples the limb.
Damage beyond that threshold is lost. If holding a shield,
double the penalty to hit: -4 for shield arm instead of -2.

Reduce the wounding multiplier of large piercing (pi+), huge
piercing (pi++), and impaling (imp) damage to x1. Any major
wound (loss of over ½ HP from one blow) cripples the limb.
Damage beyond that threshold is lost.

If holding a shield, double the penalty to hit: -8 for
shield hand instead of -4. Reduce the wounding multiplier of
large piercing (pi+), huge piercing (pi++), and impaling
(imp) damage to x1. Any major wound (loss of over ⅓ HP
from one blow) cripples the extremity. Damage beyond that
threshold is lost.

Reduce the wounding multiplier of large piercing (pi+), huge
piercing (pi++), and impaling (imp) damage to x1. Any major
wound (loss of over ⅓ HP from one blow) cripples the
extremity. Damage beyond that threshold is lost.

An attack that misses by 1 hits the torso instead. Neck and
throat. Increase the wounding multiplier of crushing (cr)
and corrosion (cor) attacks to x1½, and that of cutting
(cut) damage to x2. At the GM’s option, anyone killed by a
cutting (cut) blow to the neck is decapitated!

An attack that misses by 1 hits the torso instead. Heart,
lungs, kidneys, etc. Increase the wounding modifier for an
impaling (imp) or any piercing (pi-, pi, pi+, pi++) attack
to x3. Increase the wounding modifier for a tight-beam
burning (burn) attack to x2. Other attacks cannot target the
vitals.

features.situation: on all HT rolls related to drinking

children.name: Sympathy
children.notes: Death of one party kills the other

children.name: Sympathy
children.notes: Death of one party kills the other and wounds affect ally but not you

children.notes: Death of one party reduces the other to 0 HP

children.name: Sympathy
children.notes: Death of one party reduces the other to 0 HP and wounds affect ally but not you

features.situation: from those attracted to members of your sex, +2 from everyone else
from those attracted to members of your sex, +2 from everyone else

modifiers.name: Off-the-Shelf Looks
modifiers.notes: Halves the usual reaction bonus - adjust manually

features.situation: from those attracted to members of your sex, +2 from everyone else. Exception: Members of the same sex with reason to dislike you (more than -4 in reaction penalties regardless of bonuses) resent your good looks and react at -2 instead.

from those attracted to members of your sex, +2 from everyone else. Exception: Members of the same sex with reason to dislike you (more than -4 in reaction penalties regardless of bonuses) resent your good looks and react at -2 instead.

from those attracted to members of your sex, +2 from everyone else. Exception: Members of the same sex with reason to dislike you (more than -4 in reaction penalties regardless of bonuses) resent your good looks and react at -2 instead.
from sapient being with whom you actively interact (converse, lecture, etc.)

modifiers.name: People Affected
modifiers.notes: Almost everyone except @large class of people@

features.situation: from others aware of your reputation
to trained Acting skill for the sole purpose of "acting innocent"

children.name: Less Sleep
children.notes: Require 1 hour/level less sleep for a full night's rest (max 4)

children.name: Money
children.notes: For equipment normally bought with money, each point gives goods worth up to 50% of the average campaign starting wealth (but never cash).

modifiers.name: Alternate Benefit
modifiers.notes: Bonus to rolls to survive made by plants in your care.

features.situation: from others who can hear your voice

children.name: Post-Combat Shakes
children.notes: Make a self-control roll at the end of any battle. If you fail, roll 3d, add the amount by which you failed your self-control roll, and look up the result on the Fright Check Table.

children.name: Social Stigma (Second-Class Citizen)
children.notes: You belong to a group that receives fewer rights and privileges than “full citizens.”

features.situation: from others except those of your own kind

children.name: Obsession
children.notes: To see the pursuit of deep magic through.

skills.name: Area Knowledge
skills.notes: General nature of its settlements and towns, political allegiances, leaders, and most citizens of Status 5+
